Posts.Content: Nov 1, 2012 01:22PM nanatwo6 wrote: Hello, I am meeting with my MO for the first time tomorrow. I was dx with bc after a routine mammo at the end of August. I have already had a bilateral mastectomy with TE on Oct 9th, on Oct 16th another surgery to remove the TE and necrosis from both sides, so not off to a good start already. My path report showed I had clear margins, tumor size 3.0 cm, grade 2, and 0/3 nodes, although it said something about isolated tumor cells in the first node, that I will be asking about tomorrow. It was invasive ductual carcinoma, and I am ER-,PR- and HER2-, so I know chemo is a given just not sure of what kinds. Glad I will have others to share this journey, hopefully we will be able to help each other.  Take care,,,,,
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo Nov. 2012 Angel67 michellej1980

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2012 10:25PM nanatwo6 wrote: Hi ladies, Picked up my new scripts today for nausea,,,ativan and compazine,,,thought for sure he'd give me zofran. What seems to be working for all of you ? I also seem to have a rash all over my chest where the port was put in, trying hard not to scratch it 5LuvBugs...like your new name and picture teacher911...I will be following your progress as it is the same as mine, are you doing every other week ? Enjoy the rest of your weekend !
Posts.Title: Starting chemo November 2012 michellej1980 IamNancy

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2012 05:20PM nanatwo6 wrote: 5luvbugs,,,itchy just doesn't describe it !!! Woke up this morning with a rash all around the port site, under my arm, up my neck and on my face. Took a benadryl and that helped. Almost looks like a reaction to whatever they swabbed my skin with before putting in the port, and under the bandage it looks raw where the adhesive was. Darn,,,,just one more thing to add to the list, hoping it doesn't delay the start of my chemo. txjunebug,,,hope the meds work just as well for me :)
Posts.Title: Starting chemo November 2012 michellej1980 IamNancy

Posts.Content: Nov 15, 2012 05:01PM nanatwo6 wrote: Hi !! Looks like I am just making it under the wire for the November 2012 group, I start my chemo on Tuesday the 20th. Had my port put in this morning and it is very uncomfortable right now and hurts to turn my head to the left. I will be having AC x 4 followed by Taxol x 4, and neulasta shots the day after treatment. From reading all the previous posts looks like I won't be enjoying our traditional turkey dinner on Thursaday as it will be day 3 and most of you say the SE are kicking in by then. Hoping to learn from you all and give my support to you also !
Posts.Title: Starting chemo November 2012 michellej1980 IamNancy

Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2012 09:55AM nanatwo6 wrote: TriciaM....that soup sounds so yummy, I will be making some of it real soon. How many days after my first treatment before I feel crummy or will that be right away ? After everything I already have been through you'd think I wouldn't be scared,,,,but the chemo part has me shaking in my boots !!! Guess I  better start taking the Xanax again :) Enjoy your weekend ladies,,do something nice just for yourself !!
Posts.Title: Starting chemo November 2012 michellej1980 IamNancy

Posts.Content: Nov 20, 2012 07:55PM nanatwo6 wrote: txjunebug,,,took benadryl for the itch,called the doctor and he said I was allergic to the wash they used on me before the port was put in,something new everyday!! Well today was my first chemo treatment, talk about scared, I could hardly breathe. Got thru it just fine though, I do feel a little yucky now,hoping it passes real soon. And I am sick of drinking WATER already !!! Take care ladies <3<3
